categories.name: Ancient Civilizations: Beyond Egypt and Rome

questions.clue: This ancient civilization, known for its use of cuneiform writing, flourished in the Mesopotamian region.
This civilization, known for creating a vast empire in the Andes, existed in what is now Peru before the Spanish conquest.
Renowned for their advanced city planning and drainage systems, this civilization thrived in the Indus Valley around 2500 BCE.
This ancient civilization, centered on the island of Crete, is considered Europe's first advanced civilization and is known for its palatial sites like Knossos.
The Kingdom of Kush, known for its powerful queens and pyramids, was located south of Egypt along this river.

categories.name: The Science of Sound: Acoustics Explained

questions.clue: This term describes the speed at which sound travels through an object or medium.
Measured in decibels, this term refers to the power or intensity of a sound.
This phenomenon occurs when a sound wave is reflected back to the listener, often heard in a canyon.
This scientific term refers to the effect of an object's motion on the frequency of sound waves, as experienced with a passing siren.
This principle explains how sound waves can constructively or destructively interfere with one another.
This 1997 debut novel by J.K. Rowling introduced readers to the world of Hogwarts and a certain boy wizard.
questions.answer: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

questions.clue: Published in 1960, this debut novel by Harper Lee won the Pulitzer Prize and addresses themes of racial injustice.
This 1925 debut novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald established him as a major American writer and is considered a classic of 20th-century literature.
Released in 1951, this debut novel by J.D. Salinger features the iconic character Holden Caulfield.
This 1922 debut novel by James Joyce is considered one of the most challenging and rewarding reads in modernist literature.

categories.name: Culinary Geography: Dishes from Around the World

questions.clue: This Italian dish, often topped with tomato sauce and cheese, is a staple in many pizzerias worldwide.
A popular Spanish dish, this rice-based meal is traditionally cooked with saffron and a variety of ingredients such as seafood or chicken.
Originating from Japan, this dish consists of vinegared rice combined with raw fish and vegetables, often wrapped in seaweed.
Hailing from Greece, this layered casserole includes eggplant, ground meat, and béchamel sauce.
This fiery dish from Thailand is known for its complex flavors, combining coconut milk, lime, and chili paste.
This tallest building in the world, located in Dubai, reaches a height of 828 meters.
Opened in 1998, this Sydney structure is the world's largest steel arch bridge.
This Beijing stadium, known for its unique 'Bird's Nest' design, hosted the 2008 Olympics.
This Paris landmark is a museum with a stunning glass pyramid entrance designed by I.M. Pei.
Completed in 2017, this bridge in southern France is the tallest in the world, with a height of 343 meters.

final.clue: This 20th-century novel opens with the line, 'Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano Buendía was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice.'
final.answer: What is 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'?
